title: Support required values for parameter expansion
body:
### Description

Currently, `Quarkus` supports parameter expansion for environment variables. Direct substitutions (e.g.: `${DATABASE_JDBC_URL}`) works as expected, even when default values are specified: `${DATABASE_JDBC_URL:-fail_when_not_present}`.

It will be quite convenient to have a syntax to **define required values**. For example, something similar to [what `Docker` provides](https://docs.docker.com/compose/environment-variables/env-file/#parameter-expansion): `${DATABASE_JDBC_URL:?error}` â€” value of `DATABASE_JDBC_URL` must be set and non-empty, otherwise exit with error.

### Implementation ideas

I think implementing this in the same way `Docker` currently behaves is a big plus because most developers are already familiar with the syntax.
